page.title: 10CHURCH LIFE,KIRKBY UNDERWOOD
page.content: Many of the principal events of the area centre around the parish church of St.Mary and All Saints, although the hamlet of Hawthorpe belongs to the parish of Irnham. Although the parish is in interregnum pending a decision on whether or not Kirkby Underwood, with neighbours Aslackby, join the parishes of Dowsby, Dunsby and Rippingale, the church is fairly active albeit congregations are small. There is a weekly service with Family Service once a month in which children of the village are actively involved,reading and recorder-playing. There are special services at Easter, Harvest Festival and Christmas with much more village and surrounding area involvement; help with decorating the church, supporting the "Harvest Auction" and the Christmas Nativity.
